quest.name: Market for Death
journal: Jacke's rogues have new information on the final missing treasure.

Jacke calls a meeting to discuss the true nature of the enigmatic Black Sarcophagus. According to Perimu's investigation, the ominously named object is, in fact, an experimental explosive developed by the Garlean Empire. As the gathered rogues ponder the implications of their discovery, Lonwoerd interrupts to deliver a letter from their itinerant underworld contact. Travel to Thalaos in upper La Noscea, and seek out the black marketeer.

Upon approaching the inert form of the dark-robed old man, you suddenly find yourself the target of an Executioner ambush. Though the odds are against you, your deadly rogue training eventually prevails. Wipe the blood from your blades and see what can be done for the black marketeer.

The eccentric information broker has been murdered by the Executioners for his meddling. You learn from the lone pirate remaining at the scene that the captain of the Reformists plans to use the Black Sarcophagus to assassinate Admiral Bloefhiswyn. Speak with Jacke and discuss what can be done.

While he is busy escorting his pirate prisoner back to the guild, Jacke asks that you share your revelations with the Yellowjackets. Head to the Foremast in middle La Noscea and speak with Captain Milala.

Though she initially suspects you of harboring larcenous intentions, Milala nevertheless accepts the news of the impending assassination attempt at face value. Return to the Rogues' Guild and report to Jacke.

Jacke appears relieved to hear of the Yellowjackets' immediate deployment. Master the use of your new trick, and join your fellow rogues in their efforts to reclaim the Black Sarcophagus...before it is too late.
objectives: Search for the black marketeer at Thalaos.
Speak with Milala at the Foremast.
Speak with Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I was wonderin' when ye'd show up, Forename, but bugger me if ye don't look ready to mill an entire crew o' sods by yerself.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' bene that ye are, 'cause we've finally uncovered some hard facts about that last treasure. Won't be long now afore we cloy the winnin' piece an' put this daft challenge to bed.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All right. I've gathered the other coves for a meetin', so let's get down to it.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: At long bloody last, the Black Sarcophagus has given up its secrets. ...Underfoot, ye've some news for us?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Aye, Jacke. I think half our troubles in whiddlin' the truth of it lay in callin' this nasty thing a “treasure.”

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: The Black Sarcophagus ain't no dimber bauble...it's the Mark LI magitek mine─a bleedin' prototype explosive what was bitten from an imperial transport vessel!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: An' even though it ain't that big─maybe the size of a small cargo box─they say the blast'd have enough kick to incinerate a bloody behemoth.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Seems the Garleans meant to start production at their factory in La Noscea, then distribute the mines through Castrum Marinum. Lucky some plucky privateer cloyed the prototype en route, then, eh?

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: An experimental weapon... That explains why the thalassocracy was so bleedin' eager to bid at that auction, an' so reluctant to share the details with us.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: At least now we know the “what”...but there's still the question of the “where.” The Curs delivered their bitten goods to the Reformists, that much is certain.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: What happened to the sarcophagus after that, though, we ain't so sure. There've been no reports o' huge explosions or the like, so either the Executioners still have the mine, or they've peddled it to some other buyer...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: The Reformist faction came together out o' their shared hatred for the Admiral an' her ways. I'm guessin' they didn't cloy that bomb just to sell it...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...What is it, Lonny?

dialogue.name: LONWOERD
dialogue.text: A letter for ye, Jacke. Says it's urgent.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: A letter? Who's it from?

dialogue.name: LONWOERD
dialogue.text: The old man. I found it while I was sortin' through our daily deliveries.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
Let's see now...

Come to Thalaos. I have urgent news.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: I've never known the old man to summon a customer! No one's seen him at his usual haunts for a while, so do ye reckon this's some rum morsel he's dug up just for us?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, it could be...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Forename, you an' me are headed to Thalaos. Underfoot, V'kebbe, yer to take another stab at pinnin' down the location o' the sarcophagus.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: You an' me'll head to Thalaos to see what the old man wants. I hope it's good news...but me gut is tellin' me otherwise.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Yer done for, rogue!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Slice 'er'im up!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Trustin' fool!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: (-???-)<giggle> Yer wastin' yer time, darlin'. We opened that scrag's wrinkled throat bells ago.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: Ye cross the Bloody Executioners, an' ye get what's comin' to ye.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: ...Did ye like our message? We wasn't sure ye'd fall for it, but a little mystery goes a long way, eh?

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: Aw, now don't be like that, darlin'. Me an' me mates didn't have much choice─when the boss says “go play wiv the rogues,” then we gotta go play wiv the rogues.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: After all, we never asked ye to come ruin our game, now, did we? An' don't give me no long-winded speech about yer precious code...

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: The Reformists' vision stretches far beyond what them tired ol' rules is good for. Once Cap'n Aisibhir takes command o' the Executioners, 'e'll give us back the teeth we lost when we submitted to the Admiral's leash!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: We'll be the terrors of the sea once more! Free to rove an' plunder in a new age o' pirate glory!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: ...An' I'll bathe in blood to see that age come to pass! I'll kick down yer shite-stinkin' code, an' 'ave all yer sneaky 'eads on the choppin' block!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Like hells you will! The only sentence what's bein' passed today is yers!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: Well, 'ello there, darlin'. Ain't you a fine-lookin' lad?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I've heard all this prattle afore. Free to pillage an' plunder, is it? Aye, it all sounds grand, but ye don't think o' the price.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That “shite-stinkin' code” is the only thing what keeps you bloody coves from millin' one another! Without it─without Limsa Lominsa to call home─ye'd be adrift in an ocean o' quarrons!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...But if yer so keen to keep company with the dead, I'll be soddin' happy to oblige!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: <sigh> You was prettier wiv yer gob shut... But I can see I'm outta me depth, 'ere.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: As much as I'd like to lop off yer noggins, I'll 'ave to be satisfied wiv draggin' the two o' ye out into the wilds. Kept ye well outta the way, 'aven't I?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...Out with it, then!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: Gahahahahaha! Ain't it obvious? You stubborn scrags is lookin' to swipe our new toy, an' my job was to stall ye.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: The cap'n 'as the mine wiv 'im right now. 'E's set to show the rest o' the Executioners that 'e's got the stones to sit in the leader's chair!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: ...An' what better way to do that than executin' the bitch what snapped the chains on our crew!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: He's targetin' the Admiral herself!? ...Yer plannin' to blow up the command room, ain't ye?

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: Aye, you 'ave me permission to panic! 'Course, if ye'd rather steer clear o' the city, I'd be glad to keep ye company right 'ere, sweetmeat! Gahaha!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Back to Thalaos, Forename. We ain't done with that cacklin' pirate mort just yet...

dialogue.name: PIRATE00154
dialogue.text: Think ye can stop Cap'n Aisibhir? If ye sprout yerself some wings, then ye might still make it! Gahaha!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: We've got this mad mort at our mercy, but she seems to be enjoyin' herself... I'd better drag her back to the guild an' see what other information she'll spill.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I'll need you back in Limsa as well, but ye've business at the Foremast first. Ye should find Captain Milala at her post there.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Forget about the soddin' challenge an' tell her everythin' we know. Unless me judgment's well off-kilter, she'll do what needs to be done.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Have ye been to the Foremast yet? Well, ye'd best get yerself out to middle La Noscea on the bloody double! Milala needs to hear the Executioners' plans!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Oh, you're one of Jacke's rogues. ...You've come to steal the Sorrows, have you!?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Well, you shan't have them. As you can see, they're safely clasped upon my very own─ Hm? You're not here for the earrings?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: ...The Admiral, you say!? And you are sure these fiends are in possession of the sarcophagus? I must deploy more sentries at once!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Do not think this voids our challenge, rogue! And you can relay as much to your impudent guildmaster! ...I suppose you can thank him for the warning, as well.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...So the 'Jackets are on the move? Bene. I've been listenin' to that addled pirate cackle since I got her back to the Sisters, but she's given us naught what we didn't already know.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' we know more'n enough. I say we rally the rogues an' go after that mine...afore it blows up in our muns.

dialogue.name: JACKE
